description: India is still lagging in defining pertinent terms such as consent, personality rights, deep fakes, dark patterns, AI and its limits that encapsulate the rights of consumers, data principals and personalities
title: Urgently need: A law to protect consumers from deep fake ads
authors: ['Nayan Chandra Mishra', 'Var Template_Content', 'Sso_Login_Box', 'Xwelcome Backorenter The Email Address Or Mobile Number Associated With Your Account To Sign In. Show Passwordsign Innew To The Indian Express Signupxcreate Your Account It Is Quick', 'Easy.Or Show Passwordnextvalidate Otpregisteralready Have An Account', 'Signin', 'Sso_Social_Box', 'Sign In Withgmailfacebookapple', 'Var Follow_Widget_Data', 'Af_Article_Count']
summary:
With the towering rise of artificial intelligence-based deep learning, dark patterns are transcending to more sophisticated and eye-catching methods.
While the definitions of consumer rights (s 2(9)), misleading advertisement (s 2(28)), and unfair trade practices (s 2(47)) are broad enough to encompass the usage of deepfakes, most perpetrators are unknown.
For instance, the California Consumer Privacy Act, 2018, while defining consent, stated that consent obtained through dark patterns shall not be considered valid.
We are still lagging in defining some pertinent terms such as consent, personality rights, deep fakes, dark patterns, AI and its limits that encapsulate the rights of consumers, data principals and personalities.
Furthermore, the draft guidelines on dark patterns should also add the use of AI-based deepfakes in its annexure to encapsulate the rising trend.

description: Deepfake porn is on the rise. The new documentary Another Body is a gut-churning inside look at what it’s like for the women targeted.

summary:

As WIRED reported earlier this week, nonconsensual deepfake porn has skyrocketed in recent years, with hundreds of thousands of videos easily discoverable through Google and Microsoft’s search platforms.
This rise in deepfake porn is made possible by a new wave of AI editing tools available online—tools that Compton and Hamlyn incorporate into their documentary.
We won't reveal how here, but suffice it to say: Another Body does an excellent job of underlining how deepfake technology can distort our perceptions of each other.
When Klein describes how difficult it was to get police to take her situation seriously, the failure is glaringly apparent to viewers.

description: Among suggestions was the use of "vegan grenades," according to the in-question video.
title: Greta Thunberg Deepfake Shows Her Calling for 'Sustainable' War ...
summary:
Claim: A video that went viral in October 2023 authentically showed climate activist Greta Thunberg calling for the use of "sustainable" war tanks and weaponry, such as "vegan grenades."
In late October 2023, as the Israel-Hamas conflict raged on, a video of climate activist Greta Thunberg went viral in which she allegedly called for the use of "sustainable" war tanks and weaponry, such as "vegan grenades."
The rumor surfaced as Thunberg publicly expressed support for Palestinians in Gaza, spurring headlines such as Fox News' "Israel responds sharply to Greta Thunberg after 'Stand With Gaza' post."
That original post by Sincklink captioned the video, "Greta Thunberg: VEGAN WARS #satire."
The deepfake video used genuine footage of Thunberg promoting her book "The Climate Book" on the BBC in November 2022.

description: Deepfake technology is already very good and getting better, and not just politicians and celebrities are the targets anymore.
title: Here are the top 5 ways to spot 'deepfake' videos and images
summary:
HOUSTON – In less than 10 minutes, it is now possible to create nearly indetectable deepfake videos of anyone and everyone you please.
“Deepfakes” are technically snippets of video in which the face or body has been digitally manipulated so that they appear to be someone else.
But the central idea behind deepfakes can extend into still images and audio, too.
Early deepfakes appeared to have trouble rendering hands correctly, including mastering the intricacies of moving 10 independent fingers convincingly.
Still, for the time being, there are sometimes giveaways to deepfakes.

description: The hearing showed that imposing laws and regulations on campaign content without violating constitutional rights to political speech will be difficult.
title: U.S. Senate panel weighs free speech and deep fakes in AI ...
summary:
But the hearing showed that imposing laws and regulations on campaign content without violating constitutional rights to political speech will be difficult.
Klobuchar called that “untenable for democracy.”Klobuchar said the hearing underscored the need for Congress to impose guardrails for the use of AI in elections.
“A law prohibiting AI-generated political speech would also sweep an enormous amount of protected and even valuable political discourse under its ambit,” said Ari Cohn, free speech counsel for TechFreedom, a technology think tank.
Trevor Potter, the former chair of the Federal Election Commission, testified that election laws are intended to help voters by requiring transparency about who pays for political speech and who is speaking.
“Congress and the Biden administration should not engage in heavy-handed regulation with uncertain impacts that I believe pose a great risk to limiting political speech,” he said.

description: There’s a new and disturbing form of ‘cyber-abuse’ that a local senator would like fellow legislators to address right now.

summary:
BROWN COUNTY, Wis. (WBAY) - There’s a new and disturbing form of ‘cyber-abuse’ that a local senator would like fellow legislators to address right now.
It’s a concern we first told you about a few weeks ago when Brown County Sergent Matthew Wilson told us about the difficult nature of prosecuting so-called ‘victimless crimes’.
Imagine someone took your photo from Facebook and altered it into a ‘deep face’ pornographic photo using artificial intelligence then sold it; that is legal in Wisconsin.
Jacques proposed legislation that would expand the law to include what are known as ‘deep fakes’.
Jacque hopes to get this proposed bill referred to the judiciary of criminal justice committees in both chambers.

description: “The mayor is making deep fakes of himself,” says watchdog Albert Fox Cahn, calling it "deeply unethical."
title: Eric Adams’ revelation that he uses AI to speak in Mandarin stirs outcry: ‘The mayor is making deep fakes of himself’
summary:
The mayor told reporters about the robocalls on Monday and said they’ve gone out in languages such as Mandarin and Yiddish to promote city hiring events.
They haven’t included any disclosure that he only speaks English or that the calls were generated using AI.
“People stop me on the street all the time and say, ‘I didn’t know you speak Mandarin, you know?’” said Adams, a Democrat.
In New York, the watchdog group Surveillance Technology Oversight Project slammed Adams’ robocalls as an unethical use of artificial intelligence that is misleading to city residents.
“The mayor is making deep fakes of himself,” said Albert Fox Cahn, executive director of the organization.

description: Head of FBI joins UK counterpart in warning of ‘malicious actors’ who could use technology to spread ‘chaos in our societies’

authors: ['Robert Mendick', 'Maighna Nanu', 'Nataliya Vasilyeva', 'Candela Orobitg-Baena', 'Michael Murphy', 'Tony Diver', 'Telegraph Reporters', 'Chief Reporter', 'In Palo Alto']

The head of MI5 has warned that “deep fake” artificial intelligence (AI) could be deployed by Britain’s enemies to influence the coming general election.
Ken McCallum, the director general of MI5, said that the intelligence agencies were on alert to “spot” the use of “more sophisticated technologies” ahead of the election.
Mr McCallum also issued a warning that AI carried a “range of risks,” including “enabling terrorism and the spread of dangerous knowledge in ways that we would all regret”.
The fake clip went viral and attracted 1.5 million views on X, formerly known as Twitter.
Speaking at a two-day security summit in Silicon Valley in California, Mr McCallum said: “Deep fake technologies do clearly have potential to cause all kinds of confusion and dissension and chaos in our societies.

summary:
Activity on forums dedicated to celebrity deep fake porn has almost doubled in a year as sophisticated artificial intelligence (AI) becomes widely available to the public, DailyMail.com can reveal.
ActiveFence said the number of forums on the open web discussing or sharing celebrity deep fake porn between February and August this year was up by 87 per cent compared to the same period last year.
It is no coincidence that ActiveFence detected a spike in deep fake porn from February this year, a moment it describes as 'The AI Boom'.
Deep fake videos featuring singer Taylor Swift have been viewed hundreds of thousands of times.
MrDeepFakes is one of the most popular deep fake porn websites, and comes out top of a Google search for the term.

description: Into the Cyber Abyss: Check Point's Riveting Cyber Security Predictions for 2024 Reveal a Storm of AI, Hacktivism, and Weaponized Deepfakes
title: Cyber Security Predictions For 2024
summary:
Check Point’s cybersecurity predictions for 2024 broadly fall into seven categories: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning; GPU farming; Supply chain and critical infrastructure attacks; cyber insurance; nation state; weaponized deepfake technology and phishing attacks.
Strengthening Security Protocols: Recent breaches highlights the critical importance of stronger security protocols in the supply chain.
Preventative approach to reduce premiums: With rising costs of cyber insurance and talent shortages, organizations will begin to shift from reactive security to more effective defensive security.
Ransomware Reporting Nuances: The observed increase in ransomware attacks will require discerning interpretation, potentially being inflated due to newly instituted reporting mandates.
In today’s threat landscape, companies not only have to prioritize their own security protocols, but also scrutinize the security practices of their third-party suppliers.

'Less time and wastage' spent on photo shootsSome fashion brands haven't moved completely into AI, but are starting the journey.

description: In  an era dominated by artificial intelligence (AI), a new breed of mischief has  emerged - deepfakes. These cunning concoctions, born from the marriage of “deep  learning” and “fake,” are causing...
title: Are Deep Fakes Digital Chameleons?
summary:
This incident highlights the potential financial devastation that deepfake technology can wreak, underscoring the urgent need for safeguards against such exploitation.
Driven by sophisticated artificial intelligence, these digital chameleons can seamlessly transpose one person’s likeness onto another person, creating videos and audio recordings that are virtually indistinguishable from reality.
Simultaneously, public awareness campaigns and media literacy programs empower individuals to distinguish genuine content from manipulated material, fostering a more discerning digital society.
Moreover, ethical AI development and digital forensics expertise play a vital role in verifying the authenticity of content and promoting responsible AI use.
By combining these approaches, we can enhance our defences against deepfakes, safeguarding the integrity of digital information and preserving trust in the digital realm.

title: Army college develops deep fake detection AI model, at testing phase
summary:
Officials of the Military College of Electronics and Mechanical Engineering (MCEME), run by the Indian Army at Secunderabad, said engineers at the college successfully developed an AI model to detect deep fakes and that the same has already been tested on around 1.4 lakh data sets.
According to MCEME officials, the AI model gave positive results during tests at its campus in the city.
Currently, the Army has started proceedings for testing the model on a large scale, at different field levels.
Once the field testing is completed, these detection devices could be installed at Army installations across the country, more particularly in bases at borders.
At MCEME, we are also working on developing various fake detection algorithms to serve different purposes," the MCEME said in a statement.

description: The campaign involved bots posting disinformation and propaganda on the social media accounts of members of parliament, including accusations against the MPs of criminal and ethical violations.
title: Canada says China-linked ‘Spamouflage’ campaign targeted PM Trudeau
summary:
The Canadian government said on Monday it detected a China-linked “Spamouflage” campaign that involved bots posting disinformation and propaganda on the social media accounts of members of parliament, including Prime Minister Justin TrudeauThe Spamouflage campaign, using networks of new and hijacked social media accounts to post bulk messages, took place in August and September, and targeted dozens of MPs from across the political spectrum, the foreign ministry said in a statement.
The messages included accusations against the MPs of criminal and ethical violations, a claim that Hawaiian wildfires were caused by a secret US military “weather weapon,” and deep-fake videos.

What’s more, the number of victims of these AI-generated images has now risen to 21.
Of the 26 minors being investigated in four of the five secondary schools in the municipality of Almendralejo, five are below the age of 14.
In one case, the images were used in a crude attempt to extort one of the girls in question.
The public prosecutor in Badajoz is currently trying to determine the involvement of each of the suspects, who now number 26.

title: Palestinian hardship under Israeli occupation: A tale of suffering, hope
summary:
The Palestinian people have endured an agonising and protracted ordeal under the Israeli occupation since 1948.
The Israeli occupation has severely restricted Palestinian movement, epitomised by constructing the Israeli security barriers, checkpoints and curfews.
In a meticulous analysis, Miko Peled views these settlements as a major hindrance to establishing a viable Palestinian state.
With negotiations at a standstill and the dream of an independent Palestinian state remaining elusive, disillusionment and hopelessness have become defining characteristics of the collective Palestinian experience.
What will the Israeli occupation and its allies gain from the destruction of Gaza?

description: Hollywood actors are on strike over concerns about the use of AI, but for as little as $300, Meta and an AI company hired them to create avatars.
title: While Hollywood protests, Meta signs up actors for 'AI research'
summary:
It’s been 99 days since thousands of television and film actors have been on a strike demanding better pay and protections against artificial intelligence (AI) exploitation.
As the filming of films and TV shows has shut down, the protesting actors are instead working at restaurants to make ends meet.
An AI company contacted actors living in Los Angeles, California, likenesses to participate in an ‘AI research project’ under which the actors’ emotions and expressions would be captured, and their digital likeness would be created for use in virtual avatars.
The company, Realeyes, offered $150 an hour for at least two hours of work.
Earning $300 for a two-hour job isn’t a bad deal, especially when pickings are slim currently in Hollywood.

description: Futurologists predict humans will prefer sexbots over real-life relationships.
title: Futurologists predict AI sexbots will replace human relationships
summary:
In an overly connected world, most people sitting in a cafe would rather scroll through 30 TikTok videos whilst having their coffee than strike up a casual conversation with the person sitting next to their table.
And this scenario is not just limited to public spaces, but even inside our homes.
In an ironic turn of events, the technology which is supposed to make us more connected has drawn a communication wedge between us.
According to a 2018 Nielsen report, American adults spend over 11 hours per day listening to, watching, reading or generally interacting with media.
That's a little less than half a day.

description: Netflix's controversial reality show sees five couples putting their trust to the test - but deep fake science blurs the line of truth and lies. Is it entertainment or a form of technological torture?
title: The cruellest show on TV? Deep Fake Love goes too far with AI
summary:
While those examples are low-key Black Mirror_-esque and mostly harmless, the recently released Netflix show Deep Fake Love (or Falso Amor in the original Spanish) is anything but.
Deep Fake Love isn’t just an experiment in causing totally unnecessary psychological damage to the contestants’ personal lives, but also sets a grim precedent for the future of AI.
Deep Fake Love only scans contestants' faces, using body doubles for the rest of the savagery, the technology to create full-body deep fakes is constantly improving.
While the appetite for more and more extreme dating shows doesn’t seem to be dying down - more people apply for the UK’s version of Love Island than Oxbridge every year - Deep Fake Love has simply taken it too far.
Deep Fake Love is heart-wrenching and absolutely an interesting test of technology's uses, but it should have been left on the cutting room floor or, better yet, never even commissioned.

description: Kendall Roy’s improbably successful presentation in the episode “Living+” hinges on a doctored video of his dead dad, as does his mocking of Roman’s “microdick” at episode’s end. But how exactly did those videos get made? We asked a deep-fake expert.
title: Was Succession's Logan Video a Deep Fake or a Plan Old Edit?
summary:
But here’s the bigger question stirring debate in the Vulture Succession Slack: Was that video clip a deep fake or merely the product of skillful editing?
“Because it’s static, it’s face-forward against a neutral background, and we’re talking about an individual who presumably has lots of video available of them.”However, while it’s plausible the clip could be a deep fake, Gregory isn’t certain it is.
Whether the doctored clip is a conventional cut or a genuine deep fake, one thing that Gregory points out as being crucial to its effectiveness has to do with how it’s presented.
“Is there an expectation that people are going to try and poke holes in the claim?” In this case, will Fake Logan claiming that Living+ will “double the earnings” be subject to greater scrutiny?
But Gregory’s assessment of the video message arose more quickly and with greater certitude than the investor-presentation clip … in the direction that this definitely qualifies as a deep fake.

The burden shouldn’t be on consumers, anyway, to figure out if a generative AI tool is being used to scam them.

description: The threat from AI-generated content is magnified due to the fact that so many Americans now rely on social media as a primary news source
title: Rise Of The Machine Learning—Deep Fakes Could Threaten Our Democracy
summary:
gettyPhotos circulated on social media earlier this summer showing former U.S. President Donald Trump hugging and even kissing Dr. Anthony Fauci.
However, the international community has already witnessed sophisticated Deep Fakes in the Russia-Ukraine War.
Too Much Trust in Social MediaThe threat from AI-generated content is magnified due to the fact that so many Americans now rely on social media as a primary news source.
To restore election integrity, there should be calls for anyone seeking office not to employ Deep Fakes or other manipulated videos and photos as a campaign tool.
"Beyond a doubt, all U.S. officials should agree to not engage in any social-media or cyber-enabled influence campaigns including Deep Fakes within the domestic sphere or for domestic consumption," said Albert.

description: The new A.I.-gimmicked Netflix dating series is diabolically intriguing.
title: 'Deep Fake Love' Is Netflix's Stanford Prison Experiment
summary:
Jokes aside, I can't overstate this enough: Deep Fake Love is one of the most evil television series I have ever witnessed.
Much like MTV's Temptation Island—which Deep Fake Love also takes inspiration from—a show that begins with pre-established couples has so much more possibilities for drama.
Complete emotional collapse of this magnitude has rarely been seen on reality television, and Deep Fake Love is a supercharged magnet for it.
Like any reality dating show, Deep Fake Love found participants who appear to have been in healthy relationships for at least several years.
The Deep Fake Love contestants are easily the most tortured individuals I’ve ever seen in reality television.

title: Deep Fakes and National Security
summary:
(2a) Deep Fakes and National Security (Congressional Research Service) “Deep fakes”—a term that first emerged in 2017 to describe realistic photo, audio, video, and other forgeries generated with artificial intelligence (AI) technologies—could present a variety of national security challenges in the years to come.
In addition, DARPA has had two programs devoted to the detection of deep fakes: Media Forensics (MediFor) and Semantic Forensics (SemaFor).
Defending Each and Every Person from False Appearances by Keeping Exploitation Subject to Accountability Act of 2021 or the DEEP FAKES Accountability Act:This bill establishes requirements for advanced technological false personation records (i.e., deep fakes) and establishes criminal penalties for related violations.
It establishes new criminal offenses related to (1) the production of deep fakes which do not comply with related watermark or disclosure requirements, and (2) the alteration of deep fakes to remove or meaningfully obscure such required disclosures.
Some experts have asserted that responding with technical tools alone will be insufficient and that instead the focus should be on the need to educate the public about deep fakes and minimize incentives for creators of malicious deep fakes.

description: A video of Florida Governor Ron DeSantis announcing that he is dropping out of the 2024 presidential race has been making the rounds on social media
title: There Is Now A Deep Fake Video Of Ron DeSantis Dropping Out Of The 2024 Race
summary:
(Photo by Octavio Jones/Getty Images) Getty ImagesA video of Florida Governor Ron DeSantis announcing that he is dropping out of the 2024 presidential race has been making the rounds on social media—but it is of course a deep fake, a video created by artificial intelligence.
2024—The Deep Fake ElectionIt is hardly the first time such videos have surfaced on social media, and in the run-up to next year's general election, it certainly won't be the last.
"This deep fake of a supposed DeSantis announcement takes it to a different level," explained Purtilo.
"We'll see more deep fake videos and audios leading up to next year's election," added technology industry analyst Charles King of Pund-IT.
The convergence of AI-generated videos and social media will allow such misinformation/disinformation to be created and quickly spread to the masses.

description: The “DeFake” project is still in the works.
title: RIT researchers look into 'deep-fakes' videos
summary:
But RIT researchers are also looking at the dangerous side of artificial intelligence technology – Deepfakes.
“Well, we know none of that’s true,” said Dr. Matthew Wright, RIT chair of computing security.
Researchers at RIT say “deepfakes” are scary on a personal level as well.
Some who create fake videos use them for blackmail purposes.
Researchers say they’re also working with the intelligence community to help law enforcement in terms of detecting media manipulation.

description: Soon we won't know what's real - and true.
title: Metaphysic Deep Fakes TED
summary:
A special Deep Fake video from Metaphysic, made exclusively for TED.
Metaphysic.aiMetaphysic broke into pop culture last year with its “Deep Tom Cruise” deep fake video, which was a TikTok sensation last year.
TG: Deep Tom Cruise lives in the minds of people.
So let's say the Tom Hanks model for a face that only costs a few thousand dollars to train because we only put Tom Hanks in it.
So I could have swapped faces and now I'm Tom Hanks or Tom Cruise or something like that.

description: After briefly describing deep fakes and highlighting several relatively famous (or infamous) examples this column will focus on a number of bills introduced recently in the New York legislature—including one in particular that may soon be heading to the governor’s desk.
title: New York Legislators Take a Stand on Deep Fakes | New York Law ...
authors: ['Amanda R. Griner And. Deborah M. Isaacson', 'David E. Schwartz', 'Emily D. Safko', 'Michael Rikon', 'Peter A. Crusco', 'Rebecca L. Rakoski', 'Patrick D. Isbill']
summary:
In April 2021, the Administration for Children’s Services (ACS) filed a petition in Brooklyn Family Court alleging that an uncle who was legally responsible for his nephew had neglected the child by providing inadequate supervision and guardianship and by neglecting his education.
Among other things, ACS offered the court voice recordings that it claimed supported its position.
The boy’s uncle conceded that the voice on the recordings was his voice, but he argued that his identity had been stolen and that the voice recordings were “deep fakes.”

description: Will an increasing amount of deepfakes — deceptive images, content & videos created for the internet — start making us doubt our own eyes?
title: Practice Innovations: Seeing is no longer believing — the rise of ...
summary:
Ethical concerns — There are also ethical concerns about the use of deepfake technology, particularly with respect to consent and transparency.
For example, in a deepfake video of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, he appears to surrender to Russia in the current conflict.
Government regulation — Regulatory or legal measures should be put in place to address the negative impacts of deepfake technology.
Some governments, however, have already started to consider legislation that would prohibit the use of deepfake technology for malicious purposes.
However, deepfake technology is quickly maturing and increasingly becoming more difficult to detect.

description: Deepfakes have found their perfect vehicle in comedy – which allows them to be enjoyed without fear of deception.
title: Deep Fake Neighbour Wars: ITV's comedy shows how AI can ...
summary:
ITVX’s Deep Fake Neighbour Wars is the breakthrough in television’s use of artificial intelligence that experts in the cultural use of deepfakes like myself have been waiting for.
As philosopher Adrienne De Ruiter explains, “deepfake technology and deepfakes are morally suspect, but not inherently morally wrong.”This year marks a watershed moment for deepfakes.
Sassy Justice was a true forerunner of Deep Fake Neighbour Wars, as it created multiple deepfake celebrities also including Julie Andrews and Mark Zuckerberg.
The team’s YouTube channel now features dozens of short deepfake videos, many of them boasting how they can do visual effects better than Hollywood studios.
Deep Fake Neighbour Wars shows that deepfakes don’t need to remain as short online clips; they can now be used to make longform TV content.

description: Latest Research by our Team
title: Elections Spotlight: Generative AI and Deep Fakes - Check Point ...
summary:
In this article, we examine the potential impact of recent advancements in generative AI technologies on upcoming democratic elections.
Many observers are concerned that these developments risk detaching public discourse from factual, ideological debates, potentially undermining the very essence of democratic elections.
In the lead-up to the U.S. 2020 elections, there was heightened focus on the reliability and resilience of voting machines.
Meanwhile, in the U.S., the federal government allocated budgets in the billions to enhance the infrastructure of state voting machines.
They negate the first requirement of democratic elections – the existence of a free meaningful exchange of ideas and opinions.

description: A fraud in northern China that used sophisticated "deepfake" technology to convince a man to transfer money to a supposed friend has sparked concern about the potential of artificial intelligence (AI) techniques to aid financial crimes.
title: 'Deepfake' scam in China fans worries over AI-driven fraud
summary:
AI Artificial Intelligence words are seen in this illustration taken, May 4, 2023.
REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/ Acquire Licensing RightsBEIJING, May 22 (Reuters) - A fraud in northern China that used sophisticated "deepfake" technology to convince a man to transfer money to a supposed friend has sparked concern about the potential of artificial intelligence (AI) techniques to aid financial crimes.
China has been tightening scrutiny of such technology and apps amid a rise in AI-driven fraud, mainly involving the manipulation of voice and facial data, and adopted new rules in January to legally protect victims.
"Can information security rules keep up with these people's techniques?"
($1=6.9121 Chinese yuan renminbi)Reporting by Ella Cao and Eduardo Baptista; Editing by Clarence FernandezOur Standards: The Thomson Reuters Trust Principles.

description: A prominent Kremlin critic says the Russian government invited him to a Zoom call that turned out to be a deepfake. But what happens when governments start using deep fakes against each other?
title: Reality wars: Deepfakes and national security | On Point
summary:
Today, On Point: 'The reality wars': Deepfakes and national security.
Jamil Jaffer, founder and executive director of the National Security Institute at the Antonin Scalia Law School at George Mason University.
CHAKRABARTI: Today, we're talking about the use and threat of deepfakes when governments deploy them against each other, so the potential national security threats of deepfakes.
So we have a moment here from a June 2019 House Intelligence Committee hearing on national security challenges of deepfakes.
He's founder and executive director of the National Security Institute at the Antonin Scalia Law School at George Mason University.

description: Hermann says that while AI technology is moving and evolving quickly, tools needed to identify AI content, whether good or bad, are also keeping pace.
title: Deepfakes Are Here, Can They Be Stopped?
summary:
Chatbots spouting falsehoods, face-swapping apps generating fake porn and cloned voices defrauding companies of millions — governments are scrambling to regulate AI-powered deepfakes widely feared to be a misinformation super spreader.
Scott Hermann, CEO of IDIQ, says deepfakes usually target individuals in the public eye to discredit them, spread misinformation about them, or otherwise harm their character or credibility.
““Misinformation has been running rampant of late, and not only from the use of AI and deepfakes.
In addition to the concept of fake news, we are dealing with different tools scammers can use with AI technology,” said Hermann.
“Organizations and businesses are already working on software that can better detect and block deepfakes.

description: U.S. Special Operations Command, or SOCOM, released a wishlist of warfighting technology that included doing deepfakes.
title: U.S. Special Forces Want to Use Deepfakes for Psy-Ops
authors: ['Sam Biddle', 'Mehdi Hasan', 'Dina Sayedahmed', 'Prem Thakker', 'Akela Lacy', 'Jon Schwarz']
summary:
Special Operations Command, which is accepting proposals on these capabilities through 2025, did not respond to a request for comment.
Though Special Operations Command has for years coordinated foreign “influence operations,” these deception campaigns have come under renewed scrutiny.
Special forces would use this faked footage to “generate messages and influence operations via non-traditional channels,” the document adds.
Though major social platforms like Facebook have rules against deepfakes, given the inherently fluid and interconnected nature of the internet, Pentagon-disseminated deepfakes might also risk flowing back to the American homeland.
At an April 2018 hearing of the Senate Armed Services Committee, Gen. Kenneth Tovo of the Army Special Operations Command assured the assembled senators that American special forces were working to close the propaganda gap.

description: Microsoft President Brad Smith said Thursday that his biggest concern around artificial intelligence was deep fakes, realistic looking but false content.
title: Microsoft chief says deep fakes are biggest AI concern
authors: ['Diane Bartz', 'Thomson Reuters', 'Focused On U.S. Antitrust As Well As Corporate Regulation', 'Legislation', 'With Experience Involving Covering War In Bosnia', 'Elections In Mexico', 'Nicaragua', 'As Well As Stories Brazil', 'Chile', 'Cuba']
summary:
WASHINGTON, May 25 (Reuters) - Microsoft President Brad Smith said Thursday that his biggest concern around artificial intelligence was deep fakes, realistic looking but false content.
Smith also called for licensing for the most critical forms of AI with "obligations to protect security, physical security, cybersecurity, national security."
REUTERS/Pedro Nunes Acquire Licensing RightsFor weeks, lawmakers in Washington have struggled with what laws to pass to control AI even as companies large and small have raced to bring increasingly versatile AI to market.
Altman, whose OpenAI is backed by Microsoft, also called for global cooperation on AI and incentives for safety compliance.
Others are pushing for rules to ensure AI is not used to discriminate or violate civil rights.

description: A 73-year-old man in India fell victim to a deepfake scam after receiving a call from someone impersonating his former colleague and asking for money. The scammer used deepfake technology to create a video call in which the impersonator's face and voice matched the victim's former colleague. The victim transferred money before realizing he had been tricked. Police have traced the money to an account in Maharashtra and are investigating further. This is the first reported case of a deepfake scam in India. | Latest News India
title: Kerala man loses ₹40k to AI-enabled deep-fake fraud
summary:
KOCHI: It was around 5:45 am on July 9 that PS Radhakrishnan, a resident of Kozhikode in Kerala, first received a call from an anonymous number.
The man said that he was currently at the Dubai airport, waiting to board a flight to India.
The septuagenarian filed a complaint with the National Cyber Cell which was then transferred to the Kerala police.
Apart from Radhakrishnan’s money, there are more funds in that account.
SHARE THIS ARTICLE ONABOUT THE AUTHOR Vishnu Varma Vishnu Varma is Assistant Editor and reports from Kerala for the Hindustan Times.
